```
   using LinearAlgebra
   import Random

➊ function randexp()
       17
   end

   a = [1 1]
   b = [0 1]

➋ dot(a, b) |> println

➌ Random.randexp() |> println

➍ randexp() |> println
```

```
   using LinearAlgebra
➊ import Random: randexp as rrexp

   function randexp()
       17
   end

   a = [1 1]
   b = [0 1]

   dot(a, b) |> println

➋ rrexp() |> println

   randexp() |> println
```

```
   module M1
   export plusone
   plusone(x) = x + 1
   end

   module M2
   export minusone
   minusone(x) = x - 1
   end

➊ using .M1, .M2

   println(plusone(99))
   println(minusone(101))
```

```
   module M1
   export plusone
   plusone(x) = x + 1

➊ module M2
   export minusone
   minusone(x) = x - 1
➋ using ..M1
   println(plusone(200))
   end

   end

➌ using .M1, .M1.M2

   println(plusone(99))
   println(minusone(101))
```

```
module M1
export plusone
"""
    plusone(x)

Add _one_ to the **number** `x`.

# Example

For example, `plusone(1)` returns 2.
"""
plusone(x) = x + 1

module M2
--snip--
```
